newsitem.title: HUNGARY: BUDAPEST GRAINS FUTURES MARKET TRENDLESS.
newsitem.headline: BUDAPEST GRAINS FUTURES MARKET TRENDLESS.

text.p: Grains futures of the Budapest Commodity Exchange remained trendless on Thursday on a lack of domestic or international market-moving factors, traders said.
"Chicago gave no guidance to wheat prices...and maize prices will only move significantly around harvesting time," said Janos Szolyka of Swap.
July milling wheat was the only maturity to show significant price movement, dropping 290 forints per tonne to 22,010 forints, but the volume was a modest 39 lots.
August milling wheat saw more deals with 215 lots but it only moved down 10 forints to 22,300.
Szolyka said milling wheat prices were locked in a range of 22,000 to 23,000 forints.
"Crop outlooks are very good...but a psychological barrier would prevent prices plummeting," he said.
Maize futures prices were unchanged for all but December which rose 100 forints to 20,500 but only 10 lots changed hands.
The only other traded maize maturity was July, but Szolyka said there was actual delivery behind the single 200-lots deal at Wednesday's settlement price.

"Most players already closed their (speculative) positions so everybody is waiting for someone else to move," he said, adding that the spot market and the futures market were also looking at each other for a lead.
"Spot market prices, however, are somewhat lower at the moment, so it could be worth selling on the futures market if one can finance it," Szolyka said.
Total grains futures turnover was a modest 696 lots or 311.5 million forints, down from Wednesday's 1,258 lots or 547.75 million forints.
